parameter.name: bHideSecuredNodes
parameter.help: MJB: check if option to Hide Nav Node Items that user does't have permission to access: default to 0 for backward compatibility

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: first or last

tag.name: skin:buildlink
tag.help: Builds a link to farcry content; works out whether the link is a symlink or normal farcry link and checks for friendly url.

parameter.name: href
parameter.help: the actual href to link to

parameter.name: objectid
parameter.help: Added to url parameters; navigation obj id

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: Added to url parameters: Typename used with type webskin views

parameter.name: view
parameter.help: Added to url parameters: Webskin name used with type webskin views

parameter.name: linktext
parameter.help: Text used for the link

parameter.name: target
parameter.help: target window for link

parameter.name: bShowTarget
parameter.help: Show the target link in the anchor tag

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: Anchor tag ID

parameter.name: class
parameter.help: Anchor tag classes

parameter.name: style
parameter.help: Anchor tag styles

parameter.name: xCode
parameter.help: eXtra code to be placed inside the anchor tag

parameter.name: JSWindow
parameter.help: Default to not using a Javascript Window popup

parameter.name: objectid
parameter.help: The object for which related objects are to be found

parameter.name: webskin
parameter.help: webskin to render related content view

parameter.name: typename
parameter.help: content typename of parent; providing improves performance

parameter.name: arrayType
parameter.help: The typename containing the array property that defines the relationship we are looking for

parameter.name: arrayProperty
parameter.help: propertyname of the array to render

parameter.name: filter
parameter.help: The typename of related objects to find. Empty for ALL typenames.

parameter.name: rendertype
parameter.help: render options: unordered, ordered, none

parameter.name: alternateHTML
parameter.help: alternative HTML if webskin is missing

parameter.name: r_html
parameter.help: Empty will render the html inline

parameter.name: stObject
parameter.help: use to get an existing object that has already been fetched by the calling page.

parameter.name: typename
parameter.help: typename of the object.

parameter.name: objectid
parameter.help: used to get an existing object

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: use to generate a new object

parameter.name: template
parameter.help: can be used as an alternative to webskin. Best practice is to use webskin.

parameter.name: webskin
parameter.help: the webskin to be called with the object

parameter.name: r_html
parameter.help: Empty will render the html inline

parameter.name: r_objectid
parameter.help: Allows the return of the objectid usefull if it is generated by the tag in the case of when passing a key.

tag.name: skin:location
tag.help: A replacement for cflocation that allows you o pass in similar attributes to skin:buildlink but this tag will cflocate to that link.

parameter.name: stPropMetadata
parameter.help: This is used to override the default metadata as setup in the type.cfc

parameter.name: wizardID
parameter.help: If this object call is part of a wizard, the object will be retrieved from the wizard storage

parameter.name: IncludeLibraryWrapper
parameter.help: If this is set to false, the library wrapper is not displayed. This is so that the library can change the inner html of the wrapper without duplicating the wrapping div.

parameter.name: bValidation
parameter.help: Flag to determine if client side validation classes are added to this section of the form.

parameter.name: lHiddenFields
parameter.help: List of fields to render as hidden fields that can be use to inject a value into the form post.

parameter.name: bIncludeSystemProperties
parameter.help: Allow system properties to be displayed..

parameter.name: lock
parameter.help: Lock if editing.

parameter.name: bShowLibraryLink
parameter.help: Flag to determine if the libraryLink is to be displayed.

parameter.name: bShowFieldHints
parameter.help: Flag to determine if the field hints are display.

parameter.name: prefix
parameter.help: Allows the developer to pass in the prefix they wish to use. Default is the objectid stripped of the dashes.

parameter.name: iconPos
parameter.help: left,right,top,bottom

parameter.name: bSpamProtect
parameter.help: Instantiates cfformprotection to ensure the button is not clicked by spam.

parameter.name: stSpamProtectConfig
parameter.help: config data that will override the config set in the webtop.

parameter.help: The resource path for this button. Default is forms.buttons.value.

parameter.name: bShowPageDropdown

parameter.help: Keeps track of the page the user is currently on in session against this key.

parameter.help: Start or End - allows the tag to be used

parameter.help: Items replace corresponding {n} placeholders in the translation. Can be a single simple value or an array of simple values.

parameter.help: Variable name to store a child class (first|last) during a loop

parameter.name: honoursecurity

parameter.name: object

parameter.help: The type of the associated object (can be non-coapi, e.g. security)

parameter.name: event

parameter.name: userid

parameter.help: Default timeout of wizard of 15 minutes

parameter.help: The name of the CALLER variable that contains the stwizard structure

parameter.name: bShowLibraryLink
parameter.help: Flag to determine if the libraryLink is to be displayed.

parameter.name: r_stwizard
parameter.help: Name of structure to return the stwizard to the Caller.

parameter.name: excludeAction
parameter.help: Any actions to exclude

parameter.name: defaultMirrorID
parameter.help: optional UUID

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: The title of the message

parameter.name: toolTip
parameter.help: The actual message. This can be replaced with generatedContent

parameter.name: id
parameter.help: Generate unique javascript id if required

parameter.name: aPanels
parameter.help: An array of Panels

parameter.name: index
parameter.help: Index of each message variable

parameter.name: bubble
parameter.help: Bubble data struct variable

parameter.name: aPanels
parameter.help: An array of Panels

parameter.name: title
parameter.help: The title of the message

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: The actual message. This can be replaced with generatedContent

parameter.name: pause
parameter.help: How long the message appears before being removed

parameter.name: bAutoHide
parameter.help: Automatically hide the message after the pause

parameter.name: old
parameter.help: The old value. This should either be a string (will be stripped of HTML tags and compared by word) or an array.

parameter.name: new
parameter.help: The new value. This should be in the same format as old.

parameter.name: diff
parameter.help: The variable that the result is stored in. During execution this variable contains individual diff structs: { diff="+|-|=", oldindex, oldvalue, newindex, newvalue }. After execution this variable contains an array of all diffs. Defaults to "diff"

parameter.name: values
parameter.help: The source set. Can be a list, array, or struct.

parameter.name: value1
parameter.help: The variable that will contain the first value to be compared for an iteration. Defaults to "value1"

parameter.name: value2
parameter.help: The variable that will contain the second value to be compared for an iteration. Defaults to "value2"

parameter.name: sendback
parameter.help: The variable that will contain the result of the comparison. Should be set to 0 for "equal" values, less than 0 if the first value is "less" than the second, and more than 0 if the first value is "more" than the second. Defaults to "sendback"

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: The result of the sort. For lists and arrays this is the sorted set. For structs this is an ordered list of keys.

parameter.name: values
parameter.help: The set of source values. Can be a struct, array, list, or query. Lists must be comma delimited.

parameter.name: index
parameter.help: The variable that will contain the index of the source item. For structs this is the key. Defaults to "index"

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The variable that will contain the value of the source item. For queries this is a struct of the column values. If this value is a non-simple value (e.g. struct) editing it will alter the source set. Defaults to "value"

parameter.name: sendback
parameter.help: The variable that enclosed code will add output items to. The type of this variable depends on the output set type. For structs, this is a struct which gets merged into the output set. For arrays, this is an array that gets appended to the output set. For lists this is a string that gets appended to the output list. For queries this is an array of row structs (containing one empty struct by default), each of which is appended to the output query. If this variable is "empty" (e.g. empty struct) no items are added to the output set. Defaults to "sendback"

parameter.name: resulttype
parameter.help: The output set type. Defaults to the same type as the source set. Values: "struct", "array", "list", or "querynew('col1,col2')"

parameter.name: result
parameter.help: The variable the output set is stored in once this tag has finished execution. Defaults to "result"

parameter.name: delimiters
parameter.help: Only applies for resulttype="list". Specifies an alternate delimiter for the output set.

parameter.name: bAllowOverflow
parameter.help: By default the css will set overflow-x to hidden. This fixes the problem where IE6 adds an extra 3px margin to two columns that are floated up against each other.

parameter.name: bLayoutOnly
parameter.help: option to not include the content div

function.name: getCOAPIComponents
function.help: Get query of COAPI components by package directory. Component path: application.coapi.coapiadmin. Scope location: application.coapi.coapiadmin.

function.name: setFU
function.help: Sets an fu Component path: application.factory.oFU. Scope location: application.factory.oFU.

parameter.name: objectid
parameter.help: objectid of object to link to

parameter.name: alias
parameter.help: alias of object to link to

parameter.name: querystring
parameter.help: extra querystring parameters

parameter.name: bPermantLink
parameter.help: used to set the FU to be either 1 or 2

function.name: refreshApplicationScope
function.help: Updates the fu application scope with all the persistent FU mappings from the database. Component path: application.factory.oFU. Scope location: application.factory.oFU.

function.name: deleteFU
function.help: Deletes a mappings and writes the map file to disk Component path: application.factory.oFU. Scope location: application.factory.oFU.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.help: old alias of object to delete

function.name: getFU
function.help: Retrieves fu for a real url, returns original ufu if non existent. Component path: application.factory.oFU. Scope location: application.factory.oFU.

parameter.name: objectid
parameter.help: objectid of object to link to

function.name: listContainsAnyNoCase
function.help: Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

parameter.name: list1
parameter.help: The list being searched

parameter.name: list2
parameter.help: The list of search terms

parameter.name: delimiters
parameter.help: Delimiters used by lists

function.name: structMerge
function.help: Performs a deep merge on two structs Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

function.name: listIntersection
function.help: Returns the items in list2 that are also in list2 Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

function.name: listSlice
function.help: Returns the specified elements of the list Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

parameter.name: list
parameter.help: The list being sliced

parameter.name: start
parameter.help: The start index of the slice. Negative numbers are reverse indexes: -1 is last item.

parameter.name: end
parameter.help: The end index of the slice. Negative values are reverse indexes: -1 is last item.

parameter.name: delimiters
parameter.help: Delimiters used by list

function.name: getPath
function.help: Finds the component in core/plugins/project, and returns its path Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

function.name: arrayFind
function.help: Returns the index of the first element that matches the specified value. 0 if not found. Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

parameter.name: ar
parameter.help: The array to search

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The value to find

function.name: listDiff
function.help: Returns the items in list2 that aren't in list2 Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

function.name: structCreate
function.help: Creates and populates a struct with the provided arguments Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

function.name: listMerge
function.help: Adds items from the second list to the first, where they aren't already present Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

parameter.name: list1
parameter.help: The list being built on

parameter.name: list2
parameter.help: The list being added

parameter.name: delimiters
parameter.help: The delimiters used the lists

function.name: extends
function.help: Returns true if the specified component extends another Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

parameter.name: desc
parameter.help: The component to test

parameter.name: anc
parameter.help: The ancestor to check for

function.name: listReverse
function.help: Reverses a list Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

function.name: listFilter
function.help: Filters the items in a list though a regular expression Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

parameter.name: list
parameter.help: The list being filtered

parameter.name: filter
parameter.help: The regular expression to filter by

parameter.name: delimiters
parameter.help: Delimiters used by list

function.name: getComponents
function.help: Returns a list of components for a package Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

function.name: listContainsAny
function.help: Component path: application.factory.oUtils. Scope location: application.factory.oUtils.

parameter.name: list1
parameter.help: The list being searched

parameter.name: list2
parameter.help: The list of search terms

parameter.name: delimiters
parameter.help: Delimiters used by lists

function.name: isValidLocale
function.help: Component path: application.i18nUtils. Scope location: application.i18nUtils.

function.name: getLocaleNames
function.help: returns list of locale names, UNICODE direction char (LRE/RLE) added as required Component path: application.i18nUtils. Scope location: application.i18nUtils.

function.name: showCountry
function.help: returns display country name for give locale Component path: application.i18nUtils. Scope location: application.i18nUtils.

function.name: getLocales
function.help: returns list of locales Component path: application.i18nUtils. Scope location: application.i18nUtils.

function.name: showLanguage
function.help: returns display country name for give locale Component path: application.i18nUtils. Scope location: application.i18nUtils.

function.name: isBidi
function.help: determines if given locale is BIDI Component path: application.i18nUtils. Scope location: application.i18nUtils.

function.name: moveBranch
function.help: Prune and graft a node and the branch beneath it. Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

parameter.name: objectid
parameter.help: The object that is at the head of the branch to be moved.

parameter.name: parentid
parameter.help: The node to which it will be attached as a child. Note this function attaches the node as an only child or as the first child to the left of a group of siblings.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.help: The position in the tree

function.name: getParentID
function.help: Get an objects parent ID in the NTM Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: getDescendants
function.help: Get the entire branch with the option to hide empty nodes from the results Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

parameter.name: bIncludeSelf
parameter.help: set this to 1 if you want to include the objectid you are passing

parameter.name: bHideEmptyNodes
parameter.help: Hides empty nodes from results.

function.name: fixBranch
function.help: Fixes tree from passed root node down. Returns number of nodes below it. Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: setRootNode
function.help: Set root node for a specific object type. Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: getAncestors
function.help: Get a query of objects ordered from the root node to the current node. Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: getRootNode
function.help: Get root node for the specified typename. Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: setChild
function.help: Set child node. Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

parameter.name: parentid
parameter.help: The tree node that is the parent.

parameter.name: objectid
parameter.help: The child node to be inserted.

parameter.name: objectname
parameter.help: The child node object label.

parameter.name: typename
parameter.help: The child node object type.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.help: The position the new child node will take amongst the siblings. 1 = extreme left, 2 = second from left etc.

function.name: numberOfNodesAtObjectLevel
function.help: The number of nodes at the same level as an object Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: setOldest
function.help: Set node as only or oldest child. That is, a child that appears first in the list of children under the parent (ie. the oldest). Use only for new objects Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: deleteBranch
function.help: Delete a node and the branch beneath it. Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: rebuildTree
function.help: Fixes tree using parentid/objectid relationship. If nodes returned is 0 then no tree found for typename Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: getBloodLine
function.help: Get the ancestors, the siblings of each older generation, the siblings and the children of a given objectid. Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

parameter.name: maxdepth
parameter.help: Sets the maximum depth the tree will go. 0 means unlimited

function.name: getSiblings
function.help: Get siblings for the node specified. That is, all nodes with the same parent. Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

parameter.name: bIncludeSelf
parameter.help: set this to 1 if you want to include the objectid you are passing

function.name: getLeaves
function.help: Gets the leaf objects of the nodes passed in Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

parameter.name: lNodeIds
parameter.help: list of node ids, can be a single node id or just one

function.name: getChildren
function.help: Get children of the specified node. Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: rootNodeExists
function.help: Checks to see if a root node of a given type already exists Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: deleteTree
function.help: Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: setYoungest
function.help: Set node as youngest child. That is, a child that appears last in the list of children under the parent (ie. the youngest). Component path: application.factory.oTree. Scope location: application.factory.oTree.

function.name: getCategoryNamebyID
function.help: Returns category label for a speicfic category object id from nested tree table. Returns empty string if no match. Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

parameter.name: categoryid
parameter.help: Categoryid for the matching category label.

parameter.name: typename
parameter.help: nested_tree_objects typename to match.

function.name: addCategory
function.help: Creates a record in categories and attach as node in nested_tree_objects Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

parameter.name: categoryLabel
parameter.help: label of category

parameter.name: parentID
parameter.help: UUID of parent

parameter.name: dsn
parameter.help: Database DSN

function.name: getCategoryBranchAsList
function.help: Get all the descendants of the categoryids passed in. Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

parameter.name: lCategoryIDs
parameter.help: List of categoryIDs to expand.

function.name: setAlias
function.help: Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

function.name: copyCategories
function.help: Copies categories from draft to live object or vice versa. Doesn't change the tree. Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

parameter.name: srcObjectID
parameter.help: Source object whose category data is to be copied

parameter.name: destObjectID
parameter.help: Destination object for copied category data

function.name: getHierarchies
function.help: Returns a query of all first level nodes keyed by typename 'categories' in the nested tree model. Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

function.name: setData
function.help: Update the record for an objectID including array properties. Pass in a structure of property values; arrays should be passed as an array. Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

function.name: getCategoryByName
function.help: Returns category info Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the category you want returned

parameter.name: typename
parameter.help: nested_tree_objects typename to match

function.name: getDataQuery
function.help: Return a query of objects in a specific content type that match a list of category objectids. Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

parameter.name: lCategoryIDs
parameter.help: The list of categoryIDs you wish to match

parameter.name: typename
parameter.help: The type of content to be returned

parameter.name: bMatchAll
parameter.help: Does the object need to match all categories

parameter.name: bHasDescendants
parameter.help: Should we match for the entire category branch or not.

parameter.name: dsn
parameter.help: Database DSN

parameter.name: maxRows
parameter.help: maximum of rows returned

parameter.name: sqlWhere
parameter.help: adds to the where clause of the query

parameter.name: sqlOrderBy
parameter.help: Used by the query to sort.

parameter.name: lFields
parameter.help: the list of additional fields from the type if required.

function.name: deleteCategory
function.help: Remove category and all children from nested_tree_objects,delete all relevant objects from categories,delete all relevant records in refCategories Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

parameter.name: categoryID
parameter.help: category ID

parameter.name: dsn
parameter.help: Database DSN

function.name: getHierarchyRoot
function.help: Returns objectid of hierarchy root ie. nlevel 2, by objectname. Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

function.name: getCategoryId
function.help: Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

function.name: getCategoryIDbyName
function.help: Returns categoryid for a speicfic category name from nested tree table. Returns empty string if no match. Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

parameter.name: categoryname
parameter.help: Category label to match.

parameter.name: typename
parameter.help: nested_tree_objects typename to match.

function.name: getCategories
function.help: Returns list of categories for a given content object instance Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

parameter.name: bReturnCategoryIDs
parameter.help: Set flag to true if you want category objectids instead of category labels.

parameter.name: alias
parameter.help: The alias of the section of the category tree that is going to be re-asigned.

function.name: moveCategory
function.help: Moves a branch of categorys - a facade to tree.cfc.movebranch Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

parameter.name: categoryID
parameter.help: Category ID

parameter.name: parentID
parameter.help: New parent ID that branch will sit under

function.name: getAllCategories
function.help: Returns a query of the entire category tree, ordered by nLeft. Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

function.name: getObjectByCategory
function.help: Returns a query containing objects for a list of categories, including all subcategories in a selected branch, for a specific content type. Component path: application.factory.oCategory. Scope location: application.factory.oCategory.

parameter.name: lCategories
parameter.help: A comma delimited list of category UUIDs.

function.name: getGroupUsers
function.help: Component path: application.security. Scope location: application.security.

parameter.name: groups
parameter.help: The list or array of groups

function.name: getCurrentUD
function.help: Returns the UD of the current user Component path: application.security. Scope location: application.security.

function.name: getCurrentUserID
function.help: Returns the id of the current user Component path: application.security. Scope location: application.security.

function.name: isLoggedIn
function.help: Returns true if a user has logged in. Component path: application.security. Scope location: application.security.

function.name: checkPermission
function.help: Returns true if a user has the specified permission Component path: application.security. Scope location: application.security.

parameter.name: permission
parameter.help: The permission to check

parameter.name: object
parameter.help: If specified, will check barnacle

parameter.name: role
parameter.help: List of roles to check

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The type for the webskin to check

parameter.name: webskin
parameter.help: The webskin or permission set to check

function.name: getCurrentRoles
function.help: Returns the roles of the current logged in user Component path: application.security. Scope location: application.security.

function.name: logout
function.help: Component path: application.security. Scope location: application.security.

function.name: formatRBString
function.help: performs messageFormat like operation on compound rb string Component path: application.rb. Scope location: application.rb.

function.name: getResource
function.help: Returns the resource string Component path: application.rb. Scope location: application.rb.
